channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Alexei Navalny's work reaches Russian audiences by way of new satellite channel
item.description: One year after the death of Russian dissident Alexei Navalny, his widow launches a satellite news channel broadcasting into Russia.

item.title: A new health advisory calls on AI developers to protect young people
item.description: A new report by the American Psychological Association calls on AI developers to build in features to protect the mental health of teen and young adults.

item.title: A high schooler shares the story of her 80-year-old pen pal in podcast project
item.description: Virginia high schooler Michelle Liu met her 80-year-old friend Sue Miller back when Michelle was three years old. They became friends and, over time, they became devoted pen pals.

item.title: How the public discourse about the war in Gaza is changing in Israel
item.description: The antiwar movement in Israel has largely been driven by the desire to return the hostages home, but now there is a growing number focusing on the plight of Palestinians.

item.title: Maryland is officially crushing on Orange Crush cocktail
item.description: Just in time for summer, Maryland gets an official state cocktail: Orange Crush. Marylanders are already drinking lots of them.

item.title: Trump wants to cut hundreds of millions of dollars for controlling HIV/AIDS
item.description: President Trump has sent Congress what's known as a rescission request. That's where the White House asks Congress to take back funding for programs it had previously approved.

item.title: Pentagon orders Navy to strip name of gay rights icon from ship
item.description: As part of its "warrior ethos," the Pentagon has ordered the Navy to rename the USNS Harvey Milk, named after the pioneering gay rights icon.

item.title: Former New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern used a tragedy to change gun laws
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks to former Prime Minister of New Zealand Jacinda Ardern about the aftermath of the 2019 Christchurch shooting and reforming the country's gun laws.

item.title: Trump's 50% tariffs on imported metals will mean pricier cars and canned goods
item.description: Tariffs on aluminum and steel imports just doubled, to 50%. Martha Gimbel of Yale's Budget Lab talks about what the tax on foreign metals will mean for Americans looking to buy cars and canned goods.

item.title: More green card holders are being detained over criminal records, lawyers say
item.description: ICE and Border Protection are cracking down on U.S. Permanent Residents with long-resolved criminal records. Now Green Card holders are afraid to leave the country, for fear of not being allowed back.
